snippet: A health official confirmed that the newly identified infections were contracted through suspected local transmission of the mosquito-borne virus....
abstract: Several Zika cases thought to have been transmitted by local mosquitoes are identified in Miami Beach, expanding zone of such cases beyond confined area of Miami and raising fears; officials are considering whether to issue advisories to pregnant women and tourists in area.

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and PAM BELLUCK
byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami Beach, and Pam Belluck from New York.

lead_paragraph: A health official confirmed that the newly identified infections were contracted through suspected local transmission of the mosquito-borne virus.

headline.main: Miami Beach Zika Cases May Prompt Call to Avoid City
headline.print_headline: Zika Cases May Prompt Call to Avoid Miami Beach
